                                                                    More Contact InformationExplore study abroad locations or listen to our podcast!#WhereWillYouGoStudy Abroad PodcastSTUDY ABROAD & EXCHANGECurrent page:  Faculty Opportunities
                                        
    		Faculty Opportunities Abroad
    	Chico State Faculty have various opportunities available to teach abroad:Director of a short-term Faculty-Led Program. Visiting Professor on the  University Studies Abroad Consortium(opens in new window) (USAC) during the summer, winter intersession, fall, or spring semester. Resident Director through CSU, International Programs (CSUIP). (opens in new window)The Wang Family Stipend(opens in new window) for research or teaching abroad in China.Fulbright Scholar Program(opens in new window) conducting research abroad.Visiting scholars through one of our currently established MOUs with an institution abroad.  COIL through virtual collaboration and exchange with other faculty and universities around the globe. For more information on international opportunities for Chico State Faculty and Staff, please contact the Study Abroad & Exchange Coordinator at 530.898.5415.You can also watch the following webinar that we hosted in the past regarding faculty-led programming:Open the Door to the World for Students:(opens in new window) Learn about short-term global experiences from WorldStrides, an ally of Chico State. In this recording, WorldStrides shares how to create an educational experience abroad that aligns with faculty learning objectives.Faculty Teaching Abroad 2017-2022Please join us in congratulating your colleagues as they bring the Chico Experience to the world, and integrate their international expertise into our campus and local communities.  Thank you all for promoting global awareness and We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
